fields.Categories: Housing, Food, Pets, Health and safety, Resources for certain groups, Financial assistance, Replace documents, Insurance, Rebuilding your house, Employment

fields.Category description: FEMA, disaster loans, mortgage, renter, and loan protections, and taxes

fields.Description: The deadline to apply for FEMA disaster assistance was March 31, 2025. You can sign in to DisasterAssistance.gov to check the status of your application. FEMA can help with losses not covered by insurance — including temporary housing, repairs, and rebuilding.
fields.New Description: New: FEMA can help support your recovery from a major disaster. You can apply at DisasterAssistance.gov and check your status anytime. Each disaster has its own deadline to apply, so check the website to see if you can still apply for help.

fields.Entity: California Department of Financial Protection & Innovation
fields.Description: Get mortgage relief for structures damaged or destroyed by the LA fires. Temporarily reduce or pause mortgage payments, waive late fees, and more.
fields.New Description:
discuss: Should add the new information shared in standup Jun 10 <airtable:mention id="mennPN44eOv0W88Cx">@christina florente</airtable:mention>. If we do update with the new link that is emergency agnostic, this item is now not emergency specific. If the programs are different, you'll want to add the new item here and update Mortgage relief to something like "2025 LA fire mortgage relief"

<airtable:mention id="men7LRWgxaPLuF9Yz">@Laura Cochran</airtable:mention>

fields.Description: If you've already received the maximum amount of FEMA disaster assistance, you may be eligible for a grant from California's State Supplemental Grant Program (SSGP). FEMA will automatically apply on your behalf. You don't need to apply directly for these state disaster grants.
Learn about the extended deadline to file and pay income tax in Los Angeles County. The new deadline is October 15, 2025.

Learn about the extended deadline to file and pay property taxes. The state property tax deadline is also extended. The new deadline is April 10, 2026. For those impacted by the LA fires, Governor Newsom has suspended penalties and interest on late property tax payments.
Get property tax relief if your home was damaged or destroyed.
Learn about disaster relief protections to help with your energy, natural gas, water, landline, and mobile phone bills.

fields.Service_name: SBA disaster loans for homeowners and renters
fields.Description: The deadline to apply for these loans was March 31, 2025. You can sign in to lending.sba.gov to check the status of your application. You can use these loans to repair your home or replace personal property damaged in the fires.
fields.New Description: New: If a disaster has damaged your home or personal property, you might be able to get financial assistance from the Small Business Administration. You do not need to own a business to apply.

fields.Service_name: WIC food benefits for women and children
fields.Description: Get monthly benefits from the California Women, Infants and Children (WIC) program. Use these benefits to buy food for yourself and your children. You can also get nutrition and breastfeeding support.
CalFresh can help your family get access to healthy food. You can use monthly CalFresh benefits at most grocery stores and even farmers markets.
Find locations near you where you can get free food and groceries.

fields.Category description: Animal shelters, resources for lost pets

fields.Entity: California Department of Food and Agriculture
fields.Description: Get help if you lost a pet, had to leave a pet behind, or need shelter for your pet.

fields.Category description: Mental health, prescription, air and water safety, cleanup safety

fields.Entity: U.S. Department of Health and Human Services
fields.Description: Get the prescriptions you need through the Emergency Prescription Assistance Program.

fields.Entity: South Coast Air Quality Monitoring District
fields.Description: Check your air quality through the South Coast Air Quality Monitoring District.
Contact crisis hotlines to get immediate mental health support.

fields.Entity: California Health and Human Services Agency
fields.Description: Find digital mental health programs and support for youth, young adults, and families.

The deadline to apply for FEMA housing assistance was March 31, 2025. You can sign in to DisasterAssistance.gov to check the status of your application. FEMA housing assistance can include rental assistance and hotel or other short-term lodging reimbursement.
fields.New Description: New: FEMA housing assistance can include rental assistance and hotel or other short-term lodging reimbursement. You can apply at DisasterAssistance.gov and check your status anytime. Each disaster has its own deadline to apply, so check the website to see if you can still apply for help.

fields.Description: Resources that can help you find emergency shelter.

fields.Category description: Case management, and help for specific groups

fields.Description: Find information and guides to disaster assistance for immigrant Californians. Available in Spanish, simplified Chinese, traditional Chinese, and Armenian.
Work with a case manager from Catholic Charities of California who can guide you through the recovery process.
Find CalVet information and resources for veterans and their families affected by the Los Angeles wildfires.

fields.Service_name: Insurance tips and resources for wildfire claims
fields.Description: Find tips and resources to help you with wildfire insurance claims and issues.
fields.New Description: note: there may be a better resource

fields.Description: Learn about the state law that prevents insurance companies from canceling or not renewing home insurance policies for one year after a wildfire. And find out if your zip code is protected.
Get help filing an insurance claim or resolving an issue with a claim you already filed.
If you have CalVet home insurance, learn how to file a claim.

fields.Category description: Contractor search tools, debris removal, tree removal

fields.Description: Unlicensed contractors often prey on survivors of disasters. To protect yourself, request the contractor's license number and verify the status.
Find a professional licensed contractor. Each record lists the business name, address, a license status as expired, suspended, or revoked.
File a change of address.

fields.Service_name: Safety information for fire cleanup workers
fields.Description: If you work in fire cleanup or debris removal, learn about safety gear and employee protections.
See the major steps to take when rebuilding your home. This includes insurance claims, permits, and more.
fields.New Description: New: See the major steps to take when rebuilding your home. This includes insurance claims, permits, hiring contractors and more.

fields.Description: Opt in by April 15, 2025, to get free government debris removal. If you don't opt in, you'll need to pay for a private debris removal contractor instead.
fields.New Description: New: All property owners who did not opt in for free government debris removal needed to obtain a Fire Debris Removal (FDR) permit and hire a licensed contractor by June 1, 2025. Fire debris must be removed by June 30, 2025.

fields.Description: During debris removal, the Army Corps will remove trees they decide are hazardous. But you can submit a waiver to ask them not to remove specific trees on your property.
fields.New Description: discuss: the link does not take people to information that is about the waiver. This may be a better link: https://recovery.lacounty.gov/debris-removal-2/phase-2/#1741114841068-ad25e7fc-fe3e

fields.Category description: Driver's licenses, IDs, and birth, death, marriage records and property records.

fields.Description: Replace California driver's licenses or IDs. Fees are waived for licenses or IDs lost in the fires.
fields.New Description: New: Replace California driver's licenses or ID Cards.

fields.Description: Replace titles for vehicles registered in California. Fees are waived for titles lost in the fires.
fields.New Description: New: Replace titles for vehicles registered in California.

fields.Entity: California Department of Housing and Community Development
fields.Description: Replace manufactured and mobile home registration and titling documents. Fees may be waived for documents lost in the fires.
fields.New Description: New: Replace manufactured and mobile home registration and titling documents.

fields.Service_name: Personal income tax documents and info
fields.Description: Replace personal tax documents. File critical changes of information such as change of address and power of attorney.
fields.New Description: note: lets review together <airtable:mention id="menYIdVoJ2H1NfGLC">@christina florente</airtable:mention> . The link has nothing to do with replacing tax documents.

fields.Description: Learn how to replace service records (DD 214), awards, and medals.
Replace Disabled Person Parking Placard.
Replace license plates and registration stickers.
Replace vehicle or driver's records.
Learn how to get replacements of these vital records. The replacements are free, but you’ll need to go in person to a notary and pay a notary fee. Find forms in English and Spanish.
fields.New Description: note: changes dependent on new process

fields.Description: If you lost your job, apply for unemployment benefits.
If you are sick or injured from the fires, apply for disability benefits.
fields.New Description: New: If you are sick or injured as a result of a disaster, you may be eligible for disability benefits.

fields.Description: If you need time off work to care for your family, apply for Paid Family Leave.
Find job search tools like CalJOBS and other resources to help you find employment.
General support, referrals, and training to find a new job in California.
Apply for a new job on CalJOBS, California’s online job exchange system.

fields.Service_name: Worker safety laws for cleanup and rebuilding
fields.Description: If you own a cleanup, debris removal, or rebuilding business, learn about worker safety laws and regulations. Find out how to protect your employees and keep your workplace safe.

fields.Service_name: 2025 wildfire debris removal for commercial properties
fields.Description: Opt in by April 15, 2025, to find out if your business qualifies for free government debris removal.
fields.New Description: New: If your property was damaged in the January 2025 wildfires, you had until April 15, 2025 to sign up for free debris cleanup from the government. If you did not sign up or said no, you must get a Fire Debris Removal (FDR) permit and hire a licensed contractor to clean up your property by June 30, 2025.

fields.Description: The deadline to apply for loans to repair physical damage to your business was March 31, 2025. You can still apply by October 15, 2025, for a loan to cover economic losses.

fields.Service_name: Business use tax or fee extension and relief
fields.Entity: California Department of Tax and Fee Administration
fields.Description: Get relief from penalties, collection costs, and interest. You can also get up to a 3-month filing extension on your tax returns.
fields.New Description: New: Get relief from penalties, collection costs, and interest if you have been directly affected by disasters declared as state of emergencies, both within California and nationally. You can also get up to a 3-month filing extension on your tax returns.

fields.Description: Learn about the extended deadline to file and pay business income tax in Los Angeles County. The new deadline is October 15, 2025.

fields.Service_name: Employer payroll tax and reporting extension
fields.Description: Get an extension of up to two months to file state payroll reports and deposit state payroll taxes, without penalty or interest.
fields.Mail:
Employment Development Department
PO Box 826880
Sacramento, CA 94280-0001

fields.Entity: California Office of the Small Business Advocate
fields.Description: Find resources and support for businesses and workers impacted by the LA wildfires. This includes financial help, recovery programs, and workforce support.
